questions.question: Which of the following is not a Fundamental Right under the Indian Constitution?
questions.explanation: Right to Property was removed from the list of Fundamental Rights by the 44th Constitutional Amendment Act, 1978.

questions.question: The Comptroller and Auditor General of India is appointed by:
questions.explanation: The Comptroller and Auditor General of India is appointed by the President under Article 148.

questions.question: Which Article of the Indian Constitution deals with the Right to Constitutional Remedies?
questions.explanation: Article 32 provides the Right to Constitutional Remedies and is called the heart and soul of the Constitution.

questions.question: The concept of Judicial Review in India has been borrowed from:
questions.explanation: Judicial Review is borrowed from the Constitution of the United States.

questions.question: Who is the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha?
questions.explanation: The Vice-President of India is the ex-officio Chairman of the Rajya Sabha.

questions.question: Which Schedule of the Indian Constitution deals with the division of powers between the Union and the States?
questions.explanation: The Seventh Schedule contains the Union, State, and Concurrent Lists.

questions.question: The term of the Lok Sabha is:
questions.explanation: The normal term of the Lok Sabha is five years unless dissolved earlier.

questions.question: Which Amendment Act lowered the voting age from 21 to 18 years?
questions.explanation: The 61st Constitutional Amendment Act, 1988 reduced the voting age to 18 years.

questions.question: Which body resolves disputes between the Centre and the States?
questions.explanation: The Supreme Court has original jurisdiction in Centre-State disputes.

questions.question: Who administers the oath of office to the President of India?
questions.explanation: The Chief Justice of India administers the oath to the President.

questions.question: The Directive Principles of State Policy are borrowed from the Constitution of:
questions.explanation: Directive Principles of State Policy are borrowed from the Irish Constitution.

questions.question: Which Article deals with the impeachment of the President?
questions.explanation: Article 61 of the Constitution deals with the impeachment of the President.

questions.question: Which of the following is a non-constitutional body?
questions.explanation: The Planning Commission was a non-constitutional body.

questions.question: Which Fundamental Right is known as the 'Heart of the Constitution'?
questions.explanation: Dr. B.R. Ambedkar described Article 32 as the heart and soul of the Constitution.

questions.question: Who appoints the Chief Election Commissioner of India?
questions.explanation: The Chief Election Commissioner is appointed by the President of India.

questions.question: The Indian Constitution is:
questions.explanation: The Indian Constitution is partly rigid and partly flexible.

questions.question: Which Article provides for the establishment of the Supreme Court?
questions.explanation: Article 124 provides for the establishment and constitution of the Supreme Court.

questions.question: Who is the head of the State Executive?
questions.explanation: The Governor is the constitutional head of the State Executive.

questions.question: Which schedule contains the languages recognized by the Constitution?
questions.explanation: The Eighth Schedule contains the list of recognized languages.

questions.question: The concept of Single Citizenship in India is borrowed from:
questions.explanation: India follows the British model of single citizenship.

questions.question: Which Amendment Act added the Tenth Schedule to the Constitution?
questions.explanation: The 52nd Constitutional Amendment Act, 1985 added the Tenth Schedule (Anti-Defection Law).

questions.question: Who presides over the joint sitting of Parliament?
questions.explanation: The Speaker of the Lok Sabha presides over joint sittings.

questions.question: Which Article deals with the proclamation of National Emergency?
questions.explanation: Article 352 deals with the proclamation of National Emergency.

questions.question: Which body prepares the Union Budget?
questions.explanation: The Union Budget is prepared by the Ministry of Finance.

questions.question: The Chief Justice of India is appointed by:
questions.explanation: The Chief Justice of India is appointed by the President.

questions.question: Which Fundamental Duty was added by the 42nd Amendment?
questions.explanation: The 42nd Amendment Act added Fundamental Duties under Article 51A.

questions.question: Which writ is issued to prevent a lower court from exceeding its jurisdiction?
questions.explanation: The writ of Prohibition prevents lower courts from exceeding jurisdiction.

questions.question: Which Article abolishes Untouchability?
questions.explanation: Article 17 abolishes untouchability and its practice in any form.

questions.question: The Finance Commission is constituted every:
questions.explanation: The Finance Commission is constituted every five years.

questions.question: Who appoints the Governor of a State?
questions.explanation: The Governor of a State is appointed by the President of India.

questions.question: Which part of the Constitution deals with Fundamental Rights?
questions.explanation: Part III of the Constitution deals with Fundamental Rights.

questions.question: The concept of Concurrent List is borrowed from:
questions.explanation: The Concurrent List is borrowed from the Australian Constitution.

questions.question: Who is the legal advisor to the Government of India?
questions.explanation: The Attorney General of India is the chief legal advisor to the Government.

questions.question: Which Article deals with the amendment of the Constitution?
questions.explanation: Article 368 provides the procedure for constitutional amendments.

questions.question: Which body conducts elections in India?
questions.explanation: The Election Commission of India conducts elections.

questions.question: The minimum age to become the President of India is:
questions.explanation: The minimum age to become President of India is 35 years.

questions.question: Which emergency has been proclaimed most frequently in India?
questions.explanation: President’s Rule under Article 356 has been imposed most frequently.

questions.question: Which schedule deals with the Anti-Defection Law?
questions.explanation: The Tenth Schedule deals with the Anti-Defection Law.

questions.question: Who appoints the Chief Justice of a High Court?
questions.explanation: The Chief Justice of a High Court is appointed by the President.

questions.question: Which Article provides for free legal aid?
questions.explanation: Article 39A directs the State to provide free legal aid.

questions.question: Which of the following is a feature of Parliamentary form of government?
questions.explanation: Collective responsibility of the Council of Ministers is a key feature.

questions.question: The President of India can be impeached for:
questions.explanation: The President can be impeached only for violation of the Constitution.

questions.question: Which Fundamental Right is available only to citizens?
questions.explanation: Right to Freedom under Article 19 is available only to citizens.

questions.question: Which body advises the President on financial matters?
questions.explanation: The Finance Commission advises the President on financial matters.

questions.question: Which Article deals with equality before law?
questions.explanation: Article 14 guarantees equality before law and equal protection of laws.

questions.question: Which institution replaced the Planning Commission?
questions.explanation: NITI Aayog replaced the Planning Commission in 2015.

questions.question: Who is the custodian of the Constitution of India?
questions.explanation: The Supreme Court is the custodian and interpreter of the Constitution.

questions.question: Which Amendment Act is known as the 'Mini Constitution'?
questions.explanation: The 42nd Constitutional Amendment Act is known as the Mini Constitution.

questions.question: Which Article provides special status to Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes?
questions.explanation: Articles 15(4) and 16(4) provide special provisions for SCs and STs.

questions.question: The Indian Constitution was adopted on:
questions.explanation: The Constitution of India was adopted on 26 November 1949.
